intro: Aphananthe rectinervia, commonly known as the narrow-veined aphananthe, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant has simple, alternate leaves with prominent, parallel veins, giving it its scientific name. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Aphananthe rectinervia is also noted for its ability to thrive in poor soils and withstand drought conditions.
